content: Centre for sports and recreational activities in SingaporeThis article **needs additional citations for verification**. Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources. Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Jurong West Sports and Recreation Centre" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(December 2022)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Jurong West Sports and Recreation Centre** is a centre for sports and recreational activities. It was officially opened to the public on 10 November 2006. It is the largest integrated sports centre in Singapore. ## Location The stadium is located in [Jurong West](/wiki/Jurong_West), near [Pioneer MRT station](/wiki/Pioneer_MRT_station). ## History The stadium was opened in 2006, and served temporary as the home stadium for [Tampines Rovers FC](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers_FC) from 2015 to 2017. currently there no Singapore premier league team. ## Facilities & structures ### Stadium **Jurong West Stadium** is a [multi-purpose stadium](/wiki/Multi-purpose_stadium) used mostly for [football](/wiki/Football_(soccer)) matches. It used to be the temporary home stadium of [S.League](/wiki/Singapore_Premier_League) outfit [Tampines Rovers FC](/wiki/Tampines_Rovers_FC) from 2015 to 2017. It is currently the home stadium for [Young Lions FC](/wiki/Young_Lions_FC). The stadium has a seating capacity of 4,200. The stadium is also second-in-line to host international football matches, behind [Jalan Besar Stadium](/wiki/Jalan_Besar_Stadium) and ahead of the [Marina Bay Floating Platform](/wiki/Marina_Bay_Floating_Platform). There is a dedicated space for [inline skating](/wiki/Inline_skating) and dual usage for inline skating on the running track as well. ### Swimming complex **Jurong West Swimming Complex** is the first swimming complex in Singapore to feature a sheltered olympic-sized swimming pool, amongst others such as a teaching pool, jacuzzi, kiddy pool, lazy river and a water playground. It has a seating capacity of 465. ### Sports hall The sports hall consists of the Jurong West Tennis Centre, badminton court and a gymnasium. ## Transport The stadium is accessible by car, and it is a short walk from [Pioneer MRT station](/wiki/Pioneer_MRT_station). ## International fixtures DateCompetitionTeamScoreTeam26 November 2010[Friendly](/wiki/Friendly_(football)) [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)4–0 [Laos](/wiki/Laos_national_football_team)15 August 2012 [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)2–0 [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong_national_football_team)19 November 2012 [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team)4–0 [Pakistan](/wiki/Pakistan_national_football_team) - [Pioneer](/wiki/Pioneer,_Singapore) - [Nanyang](/wiki/Nanyang,_Singapore) - [List of stadiums in Singapore](/wiki/List_of_stadiums_in_Singapore) - SSC Government This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub. title: Jurong West Sports and Recreation Centre
